oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Signal array on Vung Chua Mountain

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Large signal arrays on the military base on Vung Chua Mountain. Three trucks are parked in front of the arrays, and various portions of the base can be seen in the background.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Signal stations; Mountains; Military facilities; Trucks
Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured are the large tropospheric arrays on top of the mountain. The tropospheric array was designed to bounce microwave radio signals into the atmosphere and then back down to receivers. This system was extremely effective in transmitting signals in mountainous or densely forested regions, and it was used extensively in Vietnam.
